patterns: How do I reduce my spending?
responses: Try meal prepping to save on food costs.
Use public transportation or campus shuttles to cut down on transport expenses.
Check if your bookstore offers used textbooks or rentals.

patterns: Is this a need or a want?
Help me decide if I should buy this
responses: Ask yourself: Do I really need this item, or is it a want? Stick to the essentials first, especially with a tight budget.
It's a good idea to prioritize needs over wants until you have more room in your budget.

patterns: How can I get more financial aid?

responses: Check with your financial aid office to see if there are any scholarships you qualify for.
Look into work-study programs to earn while studying.
You can also explore online scholarship platforms that match students to available grants and aid.

patterns: How can you help me with budgeting?
responses: I can help you track your expenses, categorize your spending, set budget warnings, and give tips for saving. I can also offer advice on scholarships and financial aid.
